title: Property, Plant and Equipment (Ind AS 16) Disclosure Checklist

sections.title: Property, Plant and Equipment
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under Ind AS 16.

items.question: Are the effects of taxes on income, if any, resulting from the revaluation of Property, Plant and Equipment (PPE) recognized and disclosed in accordance with Ind AS 12, Income Taxes?

For each class of PPE, has the entity disclosed the measurement bases used for determining the gross carrying amount, depreciation methods used, useful lives or depreciation rates used, and the gross carrying amount and accumulated depreciation (aggregated with accumulated impairment losses) at the beginning and end of the period?

For each class of PPE, has the entity provided a reconciliation of the carrying amount at the beginning and end of the period showing additions, assets classified as held for sale or included in a disposal group, acquisitions through business combinations, increases or decreases from revaluations, impairment losses recognized or reversed, depreciation, net exchange differences, and other changes?
Has the entity disclosed the existence and amounts of restrictions on title, and PPE pledged as security for liabilities?
Has the entity disclosed the amount of expenditures recognized in the carrying amount of a PPE item in the course of its construction?
Has the entity disclosed the amount of contractual commitments for the acquisition of PPE?

If not separately disclosed in the statement of profit and loss, has the entity disclosed the amount of compensation from third parties for PPE items that were impaired, lost, or given up and included in profit or loss?
Has the entity provided disclosure for depreciation, whether recognized in profit or loss or as part of the cost of other assets, during a period?
Has the entity provided disclosure for accumulated depreciation at the end of the period?

In case of a change in an accounting estimate in accordance with Ind AS 8 that affects the current or future periods, has the entity disclosed information regarding residual values, estimated costs of dismantling/removing/restoring PPE, useful lives, and depreciation methods?

If PPE items are stated at revalued amounts, has the entity disclosed, in addition to Ind AS 113 requirements, the effective date of revaluation, involvement of an independent valuer, the carrying amount under the cost model for each revalued class, and the revaluation surplus (change for the period and distribution restrictions)?
Has the entity voluntarily disclosed the carrying amount of temporarily idle PPE?
Has the entity voluntarily disclosed the gross carrying amount of any fully depreciated PPE that is still in use?
Has the entity voluntarily disclosed the carrying amount of PPE retired from active use and not classified as held for sale in accordance with Ind AS 105?
When the cost model is used, has the entity voluntarily disclosed the fair value of PPE when this is materially different from the carrying amount?
